intro.description: This cheat sheet will show you how to create a grid job description.

item.title: Open the g-Eclipse user perspective
item.description: If you are not already in the g-Eclipse user perspective, in the main menu select Window > Open Perspective > g-Eclipse (User) or click on the "Click to Perform" link below.

item.title: Open g-Eclipse Job Description Wizard.
item.description:
Select File > New > Job Description.
Alternatively, you may right-click in the Grid Project view and choose New > Job Description.
This wizard will generate a file in the Job Submission Description Language (JSDL).

item.title: Choose location and name of new jsdl file.
item.description:
Choose folder, in which job description will be stored.
Enter name for file, in which job description will be stored.
Click Next button.

item.title: Specify the executable.
item.description:
Choose the executable you would like to run in your job by locating it with the Browse button.
If your job read data from standard input, please browse also for file containing data for 'standard input'.
If your job produces data on standard output, please browse for file in which 'standard output' will be stored.
Click Next button.

item.title: Specify the input and output staging.
item.description:
Browse for input files, which should be moved automatically to the execution host before job execution.
Browse for output files, which should be moved automatically from the execution host after job execution.
Click Finish button.
